intro: Phalangium fastigiatum, commonly known as the spiked centipede plant, is a unique species of plant that belongs to the family Apocynaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiny, and often branched stems that resemble the legs of a centipede. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale in color, with five petals. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a somewhat hairy texture. This plant is often found in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to thrive in poor soil conditions.
